section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਆਜੁ ਨਾਮੇ ਬੀਠਲੁ ਦੇਖਿਆ ਮੂਰਖ ਕੋ ਸਮਝਾਊ ਰੇ ॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Today, Naam Dayv saw the Lord, and so I will instruct the ignorant. ||Pause||

transliteration.text: āj nāmē bīthal dēkhiā mūrakh kō samajhāū rē . rahāu .

melody.description: Bilaval Gond consists of emotions of courage and conviction. The atmosphere created by the Raag is that of abstract happiness, however it is still disciplined enough to not be out of control. This Raag expresses its emotions poignantly, with insight and has a thoughtful strategy. It expresses feelings of confidence and happiness, but without any pride.

author.author: Saint Namdev
author.description:
Saint Namdev [1270 - 1350] was born in the state of Maharashtra village of Naras-Vamani, in Satara district (presently called Narsi Namdev). His father was called Damshet, a tailor, and his mother was called Gonabai.

The main spiritual message of Saint Namdev, just like the Sikh Gurus, was to emphasise the importance of living a married householder life and that through marriage, living in the world and meditating on God, one could attain enlightenment. Sixty-one of his hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. He was also a close friend of Saint Trilochan.

text: ਪਾਂਡੇ ਤੁਮਰੀ ਗਾਇਤ੍ਰੀ ਲੋਧੇ ਕਾ ਖੇਤੁ ਖਾਤੀ ਥੀ ॥
section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O Pandit, O religious scholar, your Gayatri was grazing in the fields.

transliteration.text: pānhdē tumarī gāitrī lōdhē kā khēt khātī thī .

melody.description: Bilaval Gond consists of emotions of courage and conviction. The atmosphere created by the Raag is that of abstract happiness, however it is still disciplined enough to not be out of control. This Raag expresses its emotions poignantly, with insight and has a thoughtful strategy. It expresses feelings of confidence and happiness, but without any pride.

author.description:
Saint Namdev [1270 - 1350] was born in the state of Maharashtra village of Naras-Vamani, in Satara district (presently called Narsi Namdev). His father was called Damshet, a tailor, and his mother was called Gonabai.

The main spiritual message of Saint Namdev, just like the Sikh Gurus, was to emphasise the importance of living a married householder life and that through marriage, living in the world and meditating on God, one could attain enlightenment. Sixty-one of his hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. He was also a close friend of Saint Trilochan.

text: ਲੈ ਕਰਿ ਠੇਗਾ ਟਗਰੀ ਤੋਰੀ ਲਾਂਗਤ ਲਾਂਗਤ ਜਾਤੀ ਥੀ ॥੧॥
section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Taking a stick, the farmer broke its leg, and now it walks with a limp. ||1||

transliteration.text: lai kar thēgā tagarī tōrī lānhgat lānhgat jātī thī .1.

melody.description: Bilaval Gond consists of emotions of courage and conviction. The atmosphere created by the Raag is that of abstract happiness, however it is still disciplined enough to not be out of control. This Raag expresses its emotions poignantly, with insight and has a thoughtful strategy. It expresses feelings of confidence and happiness, but without any pride.

text: ਪਾਂਡੇ ਤੁਮਰਾ ਮਹਾਦੇਉ ਧਉਲੇ ਬਲਦ ਚੜਿਆ ਆਵਤੁ ਦੇਖਿਆ ਥਾ ॥
section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O Pandit, I saw your great god Shiva, riding along on a white bull.

transliteration.text: pānhdē tumarā mahādēu dhaulē balad chariā āvat dēkhiā thā .

melody.description: Bilaval Gond consists of emotions of courage and conviction. The atmosphere created by the Raag is that of abstract happiness, however it is still disciplined enough to not be out of control. This Raag expresses its emotions poignantly, with insight and has a thoughtful strategy. It expresses feelings of confidence and happiness, but without any pride.

text: ਮੋਦੀ ਕੇ ਘਰ ਖਾਣਾ ਪਾਕਾ ਵਾ ਕਾ ਲੜਕਾ ਮਾਰਿਆ ਥਾ ॥੨॥
section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: In the merchant's house, a banquet was prepared for him - he killed the merchant's son. ||2||

transliteration.text: mōdī kē ghar khānā pākā vā kā larakā māriā thā .2.

melody.description: Bilaval Gond consists of emotions of courage and conviction. The atmosphere created by the Raag is that of abstract happiness, however it is still disciplined enough to not be out of control. This Raag expresses its emotions poignantly, with insight and has a thoughtful strategy. It expresses feelings of confidence and happiness, but without any pride.

text: ਪਾਂਡੇ ਤੁਮਰਾ ਰਾਮਚੰਦੁ ਸੋ ਭੀ ਆਵਤੁ ਦੇਖਿਆ ਥਾ ॥
section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O Pandit, I saw your Raam Chand coming too

transliteration.text: pānhdē tumarā rāmachand sō bhī āvat dēkhiā thā .

melody.description: Bilaval Gond consists of emotions of courage and conviction. The atmosphere created by the Raag is that of abstract happiness, however it is still disciplined enough to not be out of control. This Raag expresses its emotions poignantly, with insight and has a thoughtful strategy. It expresses feelings of confidence and happiness, but without any pride.

text: ਰਾਵਨ ਸੇਤੀ ਸਰਬਰ ਹੋਈ ਘਰ ਕੀ ਜੋਇ ਗਵਾਈ ਥੀ ॥੩॥
section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: ; he lost his wife, fighting a war against Raawan. ||3||

transliteration.text: rāvan sētī sarabar hōī ghar kī jōi gavāī thī .3.

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The Hindu is sightless; the Muslim has only one eye.

melody.description: Bilaval Gond consists of emotions of courage and conviction. The atmosphere created by the Raag is that of abstract happiness, however it is still disciplined enough to not be out of control. This Raag expresses its emotions poignantly, with insight and has a thoughtful strategy. It expresses feelings of confidence and happiness, but without any pride.

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The spiritual teacher is wiser than both of them.

melody.description: Bilaval Gond consists of emotions of courage and conviction. The atmosphere created by the Raag is that of abstract happiness, however it is still disciplined enough to not be out of control. section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The Hindu worships at the temple, the Muslim at the mosque.

text: ਨਾਮੇ ਸੋਈ ਸੇਵਿਆ ਜਹ ਦੇਹੁਰਾ ਨ ਮਸੀਤਿ ॥੪॥੩॥੭॥
section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Naam Dayv serves that Lord, who is not limited to either the temple or the mosque. ||4||3||7||

transliteration.text: nāmē sōī sēviā jah dēhurā n masīt .4.3.7.
